div.ab: They want to be pruned often, otherwise they die & do not bear such beautiful fruit.

They are very difficult to bore when they are of metal because the substance is brittle & frangible. But one z ought not to push the borer with too great a force nor continue all in one push, but pull it out often. In that case, one makes the touch-hole muzzle of the cannon bigger than the ball in order to avoid the necessity of boring, because the substance is cast & expands & pushes the mold. If the borer, which should be neither like a swallow tail, nor a point, but be cut in the round like a wimble, if it breaks, one ought not to leave it there to rust +

+
but immediately take it out of the touch-hole. This you will do by pouring a little oil on it; then l turn the place of the touch-hole downward & strike the opposite side of the piece, & it will fall down. One needs to bore gently & at ease when the piece is of metal.

div.head: Bells
div.ab: One does not make them in the pit if they do not fit.

div.head: Gilding your moldings for panels without gold
div.ab: Some take orpiment in leaf form & pulverize it & make moresque leaves & burnish it, and it is this orpiment which is shiny like gold. However, ground metals or ground cristallin or touchstone are better.

div.head: Orpiment orange
div.ab: One sublimates it & one grinds it & some put in a little arsenic to make it melt instead.

Some make the one of mastic with two ounces of mastic and one of clear & white turpentine oil & eau-de-vie as above. Heat it on ashes until it is melted, then let it rest & put it in another vessel to purge it of dregs.
